intro: Sphaeralcea rhombifolia, commonly known as the narrowleaf globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its hairy, rhomboid-shaped leaves and showy, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. Sphaeralcea rhombifolia is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats.
